orego.mcts

Class SearchNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • orego.mcts.SearchNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Poolable<SearchNode>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RaveNode

    public class SearchNode
extends Object
implements Poolable<SearchNode>
    A node in the search tree / transposition table.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SearchNode() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addLosses(int p, int n)
      Adds n losses for p.
      void addWins(int p, int n)
      Adds n wins for p, e.g., as a prior due to a heuristic.
      String bestWinCountReport()
      Returns a human-readable String giving statistics on the move with the most wins.
      float bestWinRate()
      Returns the win rate of the best move.
      void exclude(int p)
      Marks move p (e.g., an illegal move) as being horrible, so it will never be tried again.
      ListNode<SearchNode> getChildren()
      Returns the (beginning of the linked list of) children of this node.
      long getHash()
      Returns the Zobrist hash of the board situation stored in this node.
      int getMoveWithMostWins()
      Returns the move with the most wins from this node.
      SearchNode getNext()
      Returns the next object (e.g., on the pool's free list).
      int getRuns(int p)
      Returns the number of runs through move p.
      int[] getRunsArray()
      Returns an array of the runs where the index is the move
      int getTotalRuns()
      Returns the total number of runs through this node.
      int getWinningMove() 
      float getWinRate(int p)
      Returns the win rate through this node for move p.
      float getWins(int p)
      Returns the number of wins through move p.
      boolean hasChild(int p)
      Returns true for those moves through which another node has already been created.
      void incrementTotalRuns()
      For testing only.
      boolean isFresh()
      Returns true if this node has not yet experienced any playouts (other than initial bias playouts).
      boolean isMarked()
      True if this node is marked.
      float overallWinRate()
      Returns the total ratio of wins to runs for moves from this node.
      void recordPlayout(float winProportion, int[] moves, int t, int turn, IntSet playedPoints)
      Increments the counts for a move sequence resulting from a playout.
      void reset(long hash)
      Resets this node as a "new" node for the board situation represented by hash.

      Sets the child list for this node.
      void setHasChild(int p)
      Marks move p as visited.
      void setMarked(boolean marked)
      Sets the mark of this node for garbage collection.

      Sets the next object (e.g., on the pool's free list).
      String toString() 
      String toString(int p)
      Returns a human-readable representation of the information stored for move p.

        public boolean isMarked()
        True if this node is marked. Used in garbage collection.
        See Also:
        TranspositionTable

      • overallWinRate

        public float overallWinRate()
        Returns the total ratio of wins to runs for moves from this node. This is slow.

      • recordPlayout

        public void recordPlayout(float winProportion,
                 int[] moves,
                 int t,
                 int turn,
                 IntSet playedPoints)
        Increments the counts for a move sequence resulting from a playout.
        Parameters:
        win - True if this is a winning playout for the player to play at this node.
        moves - Sequence of moves made in this playout, including two final passes.
        t - Index of the first move (the one made from this node).
        turn - Index right after the last move played.
        playedPoints - For keeping track of points played to avoid counting already-played points. (Used by, e.g., RavePlayer.)

      • reset

        public void reset(long hash)
        Resets this node as a "new" node for the board situation represented by hash.
